author: Javier Casares
comment: I was looking for a solution in the cloud but not managed by third parties. Having the database encrypted in a storage provider is a perfect solution. Sync works wonderful. The application UI is nice, clean and polished (both Android and Windows). Having extensions for Chrome and Firefox is a plus I don't use yet but certainly useful. And it's actively updated.

author: Si
comment: Really good but icons for websites randomly don't appear even if the website has one. This is even worse and more unreliable in the Windows app. I've reported his by email over 6 months ago but still no fix or improvement.  Edit - all these sites are major and have favicons. Eg. Amazon's icon doesn't appear in the windows app. Other password managers can do this ok

reply.author: SafeInCloud
reply.content: Some websites has no correct favicons and what's worse they might behave differently if you download an icon from computer vs mobile device. Nothing can be done about that on the app's side.

author: Paul Long
comment: Excellent app and brilliant import feature. Don't buy the in-app upgrade but buy the pro version. Both do same thing but pro version is supported on Google Family and when moving devices.

author: Darrin Carver
comment: Best out there. Really can't complain about anything.  Nice touch with icons pulled from web sites to keep your cards and records visually distinct.

author: Misanthropic IX
comment: Very good for having all your info in one place. And have it saved in the cloud of your choice.  One thing that could be improved is colored icons for each category and custom cards.

author: Tarfa Adejir
comment: Was happy to see support for Windows and tablets devices especially. Keep up the wonderful work. It's definitely a job well done!

author: Khushal Chauhan
comment: Why we can't attach high resolution images with any note? Please reply. Please increase the limit of file attachment at least up to 200 KB

reply.author: SafeInCloud
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback. This will be improved in the future updates.

author: Cihan Karalar
comment: Gereksiz hiçbir şey yok harika çalışıyor şifrelerime her yerden sorunsuz ulaşabiliyorum

reply.author: SafeInCloud
reply.content: Unfortunately, Sony does not allow 3rd party apps to access the fingerprint scanner. This should be resolved with Android 6.0 update.

author: Khaled Alfaris
comment: This app is simply excellent all around. And you only need to pay one time. It's not like other apps where you need a subscription.

author: Robin Iwamoto
comment: So good that I bought the pro version 4 times. 2 for my Android's, 1 for wife's Android and 1 for iOS.

author: Dmitry Bron
comment: It's really useful application with great features and with Google Drive integration. It's the best on the market.

author: Ali Hajjar
comment: Excellent app for keeping passwords safe with sync to all my devices and PC. I like it.

author: Dr. Ketan Rao
comment: The best app for safely storing your passwords & PINs. Highly recommended.

author: Jon Grieser
comment: Very easy to use. Seamless syncing across platforms. Great user experience.

author: Tony de Jong
comment: Love it. Tried all the big names and none come close to this

author: Robert Grech
comment: Amazing!

author: Renzo Demartini
comment: Incredible APP

author: Dimpesh Limbachiya
comment: I like this App very much but yesterday my office IT person raised some doubts regarding this Application which I have to discuss with Safe Cloude support team ' Is there our database (ID & Password) easily accessible by safe cloud developers  and high chance of misuse our secret information.  Dear support team can please help me for resolving this doubt.

author: paul o hara
comment: First class app. Iike a gobshite i mistakenly installed wrong version when I changed phones. Emailed support and was emailed back within 20 mins directing me to correct version. Love the password generator very helpful.

author: Steven Ashby
comment: I wish iAccounts (iOS) was available on Android but since it isn't I ended up trialing a few P/W manager apps before deciding to make SiC my permanent app. It helped that SiC was on sale when I made the decision. It has all the features I need except one:  a WiFi only direct app-to-desktop sync without relying on a cloud service (which is what iAccounts offered). Data entry via the free desktop client is easy enough and the app is clean and a breeze to use. Would be good if the app can be installed on an SD card since my Samsung Galaxy Tab S 10.5 has only 16GB internal storage. SiC doesn't take up much room so not a big deal.    Update: Still no Microsoft Edge extension.

author: Kimmy Noall
comment: I was hesitant on paying for an app, but I am so glad I did. This thing is AMAZING and I never really realized how many logins I had... But this keeps it all organized and safe

author: Jeffrey Kohn
comment: The BEST password manager, period!!!  As an Information Technology Professional for more than 26+ years, I have a lot of passwords I'm responsible for, and needed something to track of. I use this app on my 2 phones, 2 laptops several tablets, and a few desktop computers, and it just works!!!  No "drama" no "crashing" it just does what it's supposed to, and is very easy to customize, and the customization follows you throughout your ecosystem. A huge thank you to the developers!!!!

author: Daniel Olunaike
comment: Password Manager with no strings attached. Simply awesome. However, would you consider Microsoft Edge support? Thank you.  No Microsoft Edge on PC extension in 2018? Totally abysmal!

reply.author: SafeInCloud
reply.content: Extension for MS Edge is planned for later this year.

author: Stephen Price
comment: Best password protection out there. Tried everything and got tired of paying too much for not great products. Safe in cloud is great and cheap!

author: Wesley Trevenzoli
comment: I'm using it for more than 3 years. Not afraid of creating complex passwords for each of my critical resources. Hint: if your phone allows for fingerprint authentication, that's the way to go.

author: John Tedder
comment: That's better-intelligently thought out software that is designed for grown-ups. No silly pictures of wallets or drawings of pretend desktops just well designed pictograms and clear layout.

author: nishant patadia
comment: First ever app for which i am actually going to write a review for. Amazing application i have ever installed. App of the century i would say. Stores all your personal data passwords account details bank accounts and minute details which u may often forget . Each n every small details you can think of can be stored on this little but very useful app. Must have app in this busy world which remembers evry single piece of info for you. Best part is in this pro version you can download on all your devices and laptops and desktops and it sync with cloud so if a data is added it gets automatically updated on all your devices within a second. Have been using this app since a few weeks and i have put this apps icon right of top of my mobile s most useful apps. Thanks safe in cloud for designing such a wonderful app.

author: Paul Spee
comment: the most beautiful intuitive app I have ever seen!  Very good work! Would love to see the ability to attach bigger file-sizes to cards.

reply.author: SafeInCloud
reply.content: That is not a bug. The application treats pressing the Back button in the main view as an 'Exit and lock'  command and locks always. The 'Lock on exit' settings only matters, when you switch to another app pressing the Home button or using the Task Manager.

author: Teresa Fogle
comment: I've tried others, and like this one the best.  Seems the negative comments are from people that can't work the app.

author: Elijah Wyatt
comment: I absolutely love this app. The design and functionality are exceptional. However, I really wish it had support for 2-factor codes so those could be stored in the cloud across multiple devices (there is an app for that in the store, but all in one would be better than having to have a second app). Overall, I highly recommend safeincloud. Strong passwords are important, and this makes it much easier to manage them. UPDATE: this app DOES support 2-factor codes. That should be stated more clearly in the features description as its a great feature! Thanks for an awesome app.

author: David Mott
comment: IMHO, this is without doubt the very best app of its kind available anywhere! I loved the free version so much that I bought the pro version.

author: Kevin Lu
comment: Great pricing, easy to use, and excellent response time from developer.  I've tried a few others such as LastPass and 1Password.  Sure they're good password managers, but there isn't much those do that this app can't and only at a fraction of the price!

author: Zack Bjerregaard
comment: So much better than any other password manager. Great interface, very intuitive, yet simple. Totally worth paying for in my opinion.

author: Dave Kirkpatrick
comment: Going back to Roboform.  SIC is a good, not great, password manager. 1-star for encrypting important and sensitive data in a straightforward manner. 1-star for a mostly uncluttered UI. And 1-star for letting me store my data.  It falls apart with the clunky browser integration, making quite a few log-ins on the same domain a frustrating task of copy/paste instead of a one-click.  Because SIC only recognizes a specific URL, it can't handle any other log-in from the same domain. Even a two-step login is painful, making you stab the extension icon to fill in the username, then in the next dialog, the password.  Eventually you get the dreaded "Failed to detect login and password input fields on this page" pop-up if you try to log into a username only field on the same site after a period of inactivity. And SIC in the taskbar is already unlocked!  Just as frustrating is the developer - on at least one occasion I reached out with a few suggestions to improve browser integration, and his response was so uninviting, I deleted the e-mail response right after reading it.  This thing can really cramp a workflow with its clunky and simplistic browser integration.

reply.author: SafeInCloud
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback! The browser integration (on PC as I understand) will be improved in the future, but I have a rule not providing any feature promises or ETAs. BTW, I have no emails from you (unless you wrote anonymous).

author: Annette Seaback
comment: I love this app.  It's perfect for me.  It took me a little while to learn the features but now I  see I was over thinking it.  Very easy, clean and perfect.

author: Milton Bain
comment: Bought the pro after a long time. Love it. Dear dev,  Please incorporate iris, facial recognition in biometrics please
Autofill stopped working in chrome. Previously it was work. Even Accessibility permission is already provided.

reply.author: SafeInCloud
reply.content: Look for a battery optimization setting in the phone's Settings and add SafeInCloud as an exception.

author: James Mistry
comment: Awesome! Great UI, helpful password strength advice and peace of mind with syncing. Supports split screen which is great for apps that don't let you paste into password fields. Commendations to the devs!!

author: Nabil Hashem
comment: Disappointed by removing the backup to internal storage. That is why I hate updates.

author: Super Saiyan
comment: It's really good to have such nice app. It has  extension for both Chrome and Firefox. Value for money. Actually, it's free app incase you don't have PC, you don't have to purchase it✌️
